author: Elizabeth Winkler
title: AT&T Investors Are Skipping to the Courthouse
text:
Next month AT&T faces a daunting trip to court, but shareholders are starting February off with a spring in their step.

Earnings for the no. 2 U.S. wireless carrier were surprisingly good. The company reported earnings of 78 cents per share for the fourth quarter on $41.7 billion in revenue, beating analyst consensus estimates of 65 cents on $41.2 billion, respectively. Among the most positive metrics was an added 329,000 post-paid phone customers in the wireless business, reversing years of decline. The company attributed...
